post_text:
‚ÄúI feel calm.‚Äù
‚ÄúRelaxed.‚Äù
‚ÄúCreative.‚Äù
‚ÄúI feel good because now I feel comfortable drawing because I know now nobody will judge me.‚Äù
‚ÄúI feel upgraded because I never knew how to draw these but now I do.‚Äù

One morning in Homeroom A, the students had all their work completed on time, so the teacher decided it would become an art class. In this interdisciplinary environment on this first month of school, students came together by creating a list of animals that they wanted to learn how to draw. This activity, along with the reflection afterwards, fostered a safe place where students could create something and express their feelings of tranquility and accomplishment. This emphasized the process and as students and teachers bonded on a new level, the day unfolded as a wonderful moment at Discovery.
text:

One morning in Homeroom A, the students had all their work completed on time, so the teacher decided it would become an art class. In this interdisciplinary environment on this first month of school, students came together by creating a list of animals that they wanted to learn how to draw. This activity, along with the reflection afterwards, fostered a safe place where students could create something and express their feelings of tranquility and accomplishment. This emphasized the process and as students and teachers bonded on a new level, the day unfolded as a wonderful moment at Discovery.

post_text:
The NJDOE ranks Discovery Charter School in the top spot among Newark elementary and middle schools (public and charter), and among the top 50 statewide! Though the ranking is based on the annual school report card, which relies heavily on standardized test results, Discovery has always been far more than that for our students and families.

Congratulations to our wonderful staff, students, parents, leadership and Board.

post_text:
The Discovery Trailblazers' first basketball game of 2018 ended with a tough 23-14 loss last night to one of the top teams in the league. Our team closed to within 5 points with 2 minutes left, and played hard to the bitter end. TREMENDOUS improvement from last season, everyone!!

A special "thumbs up" to our brand new DISCOVERY TRAILBLAZER CHEERLEADERS!!! WOO HOO!!! They made up their own cheers and moves.

Special thanks to (basketball) Coach Chris and (cheerleading) Coach Brachfeld for a fun and special night!!!

post_text:
October 29, 2017: Marc Brummer, Co-Owner of Hobby's Delicatessen & Restaurant ‚Äì Newark‚Äôs most famous deli ‚Äì visits Discovery Charter School to speak about his father‚Äôs experience and perspective during the Newark Rebellion.

Many thanks to Marc, but most especially to his father, Samuel Brummer, the man who made Hobby‚Äôs the landmark it is today, and passed onto Marc wonderful memories of how diverse and beautiful Newark was (and will continue to be).

#Diversity #CharterSchool #CommunityLeaders

As part of our continuing work on the Newark-themed curriculum, and in the spirit of School Violence & Awareness Week, the legendary Dr. Roosevelt Weaver (a.k.a. "Dr. Speed") visited us today to share his wisdom and success as a Harvard graduate, track coach/mentor, East Orange H.S. Principal, and community activist... SUCCESS modeling SUCCESS to our future SUCCESS stories. Many thanks, Dr. Weaver!!!
#SuccessModelingSuccess
Montclair, New Jersey

post_text:
Amazing things happen at Discovery...

Resistance and Redemption: Unraveling The "March" Trilogy

This fall, our students will be discovering the "March Trilogy" (John Lewis' National Book Award-Winning Graphic Memoir on the Civil Rights Movement) as it relates to Newark. They will learn about the trajectory of a life steeped in social activism and racial turmoil in 1960s Newark... and America.

If a donor enters the code LIFTOFF during checkout in the next few days, their donation will be matched dollar for dollar (up to $50). Please donate above and beyond to give more to our kids...
shared_text:
DONORSCHOOSE.ORG
Resistance and Redemption: Unraveling The March Trilogy | DonorsChoose.org project by Ms. Rogers

post_text:
DISNEY CHOOSES DISCOVERY!!!

Discovery Charter School has been chosen by NJPAC and The Walt Disney Company's "Disney Musicals in Schools" program from nearly 30 New Jersey applicant schools as the ONLY Newark school to participate in the program! WOO HOO!!! CONGRATS, DISCOVERY CS STAFF AND STUDENTS!!!

"Choosing 5 schools from across New Jersey was a difficult task; after weighing various factors, our selection committee feels the school team and students at Discovery Charter School will be an excellent fit for this project and will embark on a long tradition of theater education." -- Victoria Revesz and Danielle Vauters, NJPAC

http://disneymusicalsinschools.com/

post_text: Last night, Discovery Charter School held its first ever basketball awards dinner. Dr. Hall, Head Coach Chris, Asst. Coach Kruvant and players were there, along with parents and friends, to honor the hard work everyone put in to a fine season. We look forward to building off this season to teach our kids about the importance of discipline and rigor -- both in academics and physical activity. Next up... Girls Volleyball!!!
text: Last night, Discovery Charter School held its first ever basketball awards dinner. Dr. Hall, Head Coach Chris, Asst. Coach Kruvant and players were there, along with parents and friends, to honor the hard work everyone put in to a fine season. We look forward to building off this season to teach our kids about the importance of discipline and rigor -- both in academics and physical activity. Next up... Girls Volleyball!!!
